attributes.action: educate children (with some shock tactics if need be) about personal debt, it's implications on lifestyle & personal wellbeing and how to manage it - via the National Curriculum. To not do so is irresponsible and damaging in the long term.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
By the point a British citizen turns 18 and qualifies for credit (you know, as a 'responsible adult'), there will have been not one instance where they would have the chance to learn in school or college, about personal debt - and what goes with it.

Nowhere within the current national curriculum, are our teachers tasked with educating young people about things like APR vs actual interest calculation, mortgages, introductory rates, or the value of an average customer to banks over their lifetime - etc.

Never do we make a point of warning our future generations about how depression, bankruptcy and potentially, suicide - can stem from uncontrolable debt.

If we want to control debt levels, we have to equip future generations with the knowledge and forsight to CONTROL THEMSELVES when they come of age.

Sign this petition to include the above in the National Curriculum and help future generations learn the value of work, reward - and the value of money.
